tn.text: Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"be the finest flour" or "be the best flour"
a powder made from wheat
"He must take"
"take out what he can hold in his hand"
The handful of the grain offering represents the whole grain offering. This means the whole offering belongs to Yahweh.

tn.ref: It will produce a sweet aroma for Yahweh
tn.text: Yahweh being pleased with the sincere worshiper who offered the sacrifice is spoken of as if God were pleased with the aroma of the sacrifice. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: it will be an offering made to him by fire
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "it will be a burnt offering to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people and priests must do so their offerings will be acceptable to him.

tn.ref: that is baked in an oven
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you baked in an oven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This was probably a hollow object made of clay. A fire was lit under the oven, and the heat would bake the dough inside of the oven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
It is understood that the soft bread contained no yeast. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Translate this phrase to indicate that the oil is to be spread onto the bread. AT: "with oil on the bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: If your grain offering is baked with a flat iron pan
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If you bake your grain offering in a flat iron pan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a thick plate made of either clay or metal. The plate was placed over a fire, and the dough cooked on top of the plate. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do so their offerings will be acceptable to him.
Here "it" refers to the grain offering cooked on a flat iron pan.

tn.ref: If your grain offering is cooked
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If you cook your grain offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A pan is a metal plate with rounded edges. The dough was placed in the pan and cooked over a fire. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must make it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do so their offerings will be acceptable to him.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you made from the flour and oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will present it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Then the priest ... made by fire
tn.text: For 2:9-10 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:01|2:2-3]].
The handful of the grain offering represents the whole grain offering. This means the whole offering belongs to Yahweh. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:01|2:2]].

tn.ref: It will be an offering made by fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It will be a burnt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: it will produce a sweet aroma for Yahweh
tn.text: Yahweh being pleased with the sincere worshiper who offered the sacrifice is spoken of as if God were pleased with the aroma of the burning sacrifice. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: from the offerings to Yahweh made by fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "from the burnt offerings to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do so that their offerings will be acceptable to him.

tn.ref: No grain offering that you offer to Yahweh is to be made with yeast
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not use yeast in a grain offering that you offer to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: as an offering made by fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as a burnt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"You will offer the grain offerings made with leaven or honey"

tn.ref: they will not be used to produce a sweet aroma on the altar
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will not use them to produce a sweet aroma on the altar" or "you will not burn them on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the salt of the covenant of your God
tn.text: It is implied that the salt is a symbol that represents the covenant with God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do so their offerings will be acceptable to him.

tn.ref: that is roasted with fire and then crushed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you have cooked over a fire and then crushed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The handful of the grain offering represents the whole grain offering. This means the whole offering belongs to Yahweh. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:01|2:2]].

tn.ref: This is an offering made by fire to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This is a burnt offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
